result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jury status hearing on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

8:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Mark A Connerton in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Mark A Connerton.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Broze provides an update; she advises that Atty. Wolff is asking the matter be scheduled for a 1 day jury trial.  State agrees.  Court adjourns for jury status and jury trial.  Court will prepare and sign a pretrial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Court adjourns for further proceedings.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

08:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Mark A Connerton in court.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the case on the record and inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant requests additional time to get an attorney, and obtain some additional documentation relating to his case.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to report to the Public Defender's office.  Defendant advises he does.  Court advises the defendant he must report to the PD's office to be evaluated for representation, but notes if he does not qualify he could petition the court for an attorney.  Court provides the court with the information about the Public Defender's office as well as the petition for court appointed attorney.  Court inquires if there is an offer.  Atty. Campbell will provide the defendant with the offer in court today.  Court adjourns for further proceedings/status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Lau

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives/tasers/pepper spray.

01:11 PM Defendant Mark A Connerton in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
